questions.question: A solid green signal means:
choices: You may proceed if the intersection is clear
You may not remain stopped at a green signal

questions.question: What do the light gray areas in the picture mark?
If there is an oncoming vehicle approaching head-on in your lane, you should:
choices: Brake sharply and drive to the left of the oncoming vehicle
Make an emergency stop and back up, if necessary
Brake sharply and drive to the right of the oncoming vehicle

questions.question: The following are true about large trucks except:
choices: They have bigger blind spots than most cars
They require more room to maneuver

questions.question: When are you most at risk of drowsy driving?
choices: When driving long distances without rest breaks
When driving in heavy city traffic
When getting plenty of quality sleep before the trip

questions.question: At an uncontrolled intersection, a pedestrian has entered the crosswalk. In this situation, you should:
choices: Change lane so you do not have to slow down
Make the pedestrian aware that you are approaching

questions.question: Which of the following vehicles must always stop before crossing railroad tracks?
When oncoming traffic prevents you from making an immediate left turn, you should:
choices: Alert oncoming traffic by using horn or headlights
Start turning, oncoming traffic will always stop
Slow down and stop if necessary

questions.question: When should you turn on your headlights?
choices: Any time in open country with a clear road ahead

questions.question: Your car must have the following equipment in proper working order:
choices: A bell, siren, or exhaust whistle

questions.question: When you park on a hill headed downhill, and there is no curb, you should turn your front wheels:
choices: Parallel to and by the side of the road
Parallel to and at least 12 inches away from the side of the road
Toward the side of the road

questions.question: The program that gradually phases in driving privileges for new teen drivers is known as:
When passing another vehicle on a two-lane road, you must:
choices: Alert other drivers by using your headlights
Exceed the speed limit to pass quickly
Return before an approaching vehicle comes within 100 feet

questions.question: The blood alcohol level at which it is illegal for any person 21 years or older to drive is:
If you are in an intersection when an emergency vehicle with flashing lights approaches from behind, you should:
choices: Move to the right in the intersection and stop
Proceed through the intersection and continue driving
Proceed through the intersection before stopping

questions.question: When you stop and yield to a blind pedestrian in a crosswalk, the blind pedestrian will use what as a guide?
Which is true about giving your horn a sharp blast?
choices: Never blast your horn if you have lost control of your vehicle
Do this only to apprise other drivers of an error
Do this if there is an immediate danger

questions.question: When leaving a limited-access highway with a deceleration lane:
choices: Avoid signaling until you are leaving the deceleration lane
Do not slow down until you move into the deceleration lane
Slow down well ahead of the deceleration lane

questions.question: If you have been drinking alcohol, what will help you to sober up?
Which pavement marking separates traffic traveling in opposite directions?
When you park and leave your car, you must:
choices: Turn off the engine, set the parking brake and remove the key
Set the parking brake, but can leave your keys in the ignition
Set the parking brake, but can leave the motor running

questions.question: When facing a traffic signal showing a steady green arrow in your lane, you:
choices: May turn only in the direction of the arrow

questions.question: If a school bus with flashing red lights has stopped on your side of a divided highway, you must:
choices: Slow down and proceed with caution

questions.question: Following closely behind another vehicle:
choices: Is the cause of most rear-end accidents

questions.question: Which of the following traffic violations will add more than four points to your driver's record?
choices: Speeding 15 mph over the limit resulting in a collision

questions.question: If you stay inside the protection of your vehicle, your chances of surviving a crash are:
When following an emergency vehicle using sirens and flashing red lights, you must:
choices: Slow down to 25 mph or less

questions.question: Which is true about the right of way at a 4-way stop?
choices: The first vehicle to reach the stop is the first to go
The vehicle to the left always has the right of way
The vehicle to the right always has the right of way

questions.question: Can you drive with just your parking lights on when headlights are required?
choices: Yes, when there are no other vehicles around
Yes, when driving slower than 25 mph

questions.question: When entering an expressway or a limited-access highway, it is wrong to:
choices: Enter at or near the speed of traffic
Turn your head to look quickly to the side before changing lanes

questions.question: Always allow extra room in front of your vehicle when:
If you are going to drive in heavy rain and want to avoid hydroplaning, the most important thing to check before getting behind the wheel is your:
When can you drive at the maximum speed indicated by a speed limit sign?
choices: When conditions permit you to drive at such a speed safely
Only on divided highways, or highways designed for one-way traffic

questions.question: The most effective means of reducing serious injuries in a traffic crash is:
choices: Sitting close to the steering wheel

questions.question: When you approach a traffic signal displaying a steady yellow light, you must:
choices: Slow down and proceed with caution
Stop if you can stop safely

questions.question: Of all traffic collisions in which a driver is killed, alcohol is involved in approximately:
If you have a Kentucky driver's license, you must report a change of address within:
You should adjust your seat and mirrors:
choices: Before you get into your vehicle

questions.question: Where is the pavement marked with the letter R on each side of a large X?
A Crossbuck sign at a railroad crossing means:
When should you proceed straight ahead against a red light?
choices: When directed by a police officer
When you hear an emergency vehicle approaching

questions.question: If not posted otherwise, what is the speed limit on rural highways with limited access?
Taking a cold shower after drinking alcohol:
choices: Has no effect on your blood alcohol concentration
Helps you to sober up more quickly
Cancels the effect of the alcohol

questions.question: If you suddenly rear-end the car in front of you, you were most likely:
choices: Weaving in and out of traffic

questions.question: You are driving on a road with few streetlights on a clear night. If you cannot see well with your low-beam headlights, which of these actions would help?
choices: Adjusting your instrument lights so they are brighter
Turning on your vehicle's parking lights

questions.question: If you see a pedestrian with a white cane at a crosswalk, you must:
choices: Stop and turn off your engine, so it is clear that you have stopped
Stop and give the pedestrian the right of way at all times

questions.question: Under Kentucky point system your driving privilege will be suspended if you accumulate 12 points within:
When turning left from the lane closest to the center of a street, you should:
choices: Complete the turn in the closest lane going in your direction
Complete the turn in either lane going in your direction
Complete the turn in the right-hand lane of the cross street

questions.question: If you have a tire blowout while driving, you should:
choices: Ease off the gas pedal and steer straight ahead until you have full control
